meanings.definition: Pagurids: a family of marine decapod crustaceans commonly known as hermit crabs.
meanings.sent1: The pagurids scuttled along the ocean floor, searching for new shells to call home.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of pagurids moving from one shell to another near the coral reef.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pagurids throw a party? Because they wanted to shell-ebrate their new homes!
meanings.sent4: The pagurids, like tiny nomads of the sea, carry their homes on their backs.
meanings.sent5: The pagurids, with their clawed legs and protective shells, are fascinating creatures to observe.
